inclusion.criterion: Be 18 years of age or older.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have simple or complex partial seizures.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Seizures must persist at 2 or more per month, despite medical therapy.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Be able to give informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have been determined by the NIH neurology staff to have medically intractable epilepsy.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have a seizure focus in a single region of one cerebral hemisphere.
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Have a contraindication to MRI scanning.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Have a bleeding disorder that cannot be corrected before testing or treatment.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Are unable to comprehend the risks of the testing and surgical therapy.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Have seizure foci in more than one region of one hemisphere or in both cerebral hemispheres.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, and epilepsy. He has had seizures since age 13 and was recently tapered off Dilantin, which may have contributed to his current seizure activity.
